# CSV Analytics

Calculate statistics from CSV data!

⚔️ Analyze player performance!
starterCode:
import csv
import io

PLAYER_STATS = '''player,kills,deaths,assists
Warrior,25,5,10
Mage,30,8,15
Rogue,20,3,12'''

reader = csv.DictReader(io.StringIO(PLAYER_STATS))
stats = list(reader)

# TODO: Calculate average kills
total_kills = sum(int(row['kills']) for row in stats)
avg_kills = total_kills / len(stats)

print(f'Average kills: {avg_kills:.1f}')

# TODO: Find player with most kills
reader2 = csv.DictReader(io.StringIO(PLAYER_STATS))
best_player = max(reader2, key=lambda r: int(r['kills']))
print(f'Top player: {best_player["player"]} ({best_player["kills"]} kills)')
solutionCode:
import csv
import io

PLAYER_STATS = '''player,kills,deaths,assists
Warrior,25,5,10
Mage,30,8,15
Rogue,20,3,12'''

reader = csv.DictReader(io.StringIO(PLAYER_STATS))
stats = list(reader)

total_kills = sum(int(row['kills']) for row in stats)
avg_kills = total_kills / len(stats)

print(f'Average kills: {avg_kills:.1f}')

reader2 = csv.DictReader(io.StringIO(PLAYER_STATS))
best_player = max(reader2, key=lambda r: int(r['kills']))
print(f'Top player: {best_player["player"]} ({best_player["kills"]} kills)')
